workflow.name: Automated social media content creation with OpenAI, LinkedIn & Twitter approval
workflow.description:
Whether you‚Äôre a product manager, developer, or simply curious about workflow automation, you‚Äôre in the right place. This n8n workflow is designed to help you streamline and automate your social media content creation, approval, and publishing process‚Äîall with minimal manual effort.

I‚Äôve put together this guide to make it easy for you to get started, even if you‚Äôre new to n8n or automation tools. You‚Äôll find step-by-step instructions, helpful links, and tips to ensure a smooth setup. Feel free to explore, experiment, and make this workflow your own!

Let‚Äôs dive in and unlock the power of automation together!

## **1. What This Workflow Does**

This workflow automates the process of creating, reviewing, and publishing social media posts for LinkedIn and Twitter (X), including image generation and approval steps. It also notifies via Slack and logs posts in Google Sheets.

Workflow json: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1zE5W0Ff6EBoAFRHupWPybC-fnGZqE84r?usp=sharing

## **2. Prerequisites**

- An n8n account (sign up for free:¬†[n8n Cloud](https://app.n8n.cloud/register))
- API credentials for:
    - OpenAI (for content and image generation)
    - LinkedIn
    - Gmail (for approval emails)
    - Twitter/X
    - Slack
    - Google Sheets

You‚Äôll find help to set up auth at the end of this doc!

## **3. How to Use This Workflow**

### **Step 1: Import the Workflow**

- Download or copy the workflow JSON.
- In n8n, click¬†**Import**¬†and paste/upload the workflow.

### **Step 2: Set Up Credentials**

- For each service node (OpenAI, LinkedIn, Gmail, Twitter, Slack, Google Sheets), click the node and select or create the required credentials.
- Use the official setup links provided earlier for each service.

### **Step 3: Configure the Trigger**

- The workflow starts with a¬†**Form Trigger**¬†node. Open the node to customize the form fields if needed.

### **Step 4: Test the Workflow**

- Click¬†**Test Workflow**¬†to run it manually.
- Fill out the form to generate a post.
- The workflow will:
    1. Generate platform-specific content using AI.
    2. Send an approval email.
    3. If approved, generate an image (if selected).
    4. Publish to LinkedIn and Twitter.
    5. Notify via Slack.
    6. Log the post in Google Sheets.

### **Step 5: Review and Adjust**

- Check each node for errors or missing credentials.
- Adjust content prompts, approval logic, or output formatting as needed.

## **4. Helpful n8n Resources**

- [n8n Quickstart Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/getting-started/quickstart/)
- [How to use workflow templates](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/templates/)
- [Working with credentials](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/)
- [Using expressions in n8n](https://docs.n8n.io/code/expressions/)

parameters.subject: =FOR YOUR APPROVAL {{ $('Social Media Content Factory').item.json.output.name }} - {{ $('Social Media Content Factory').item.json.output.description }}

parameters.formTitle: What do you feel like posting about today?

values.placeholder: What is the title or topic you want to write the post about?
Include any specific keywords or hashtags you'd like
=Would you like to redirect your audience to a link? Add it here.

parameters.formDescription:
=Welcome to your Social Media Assistant!

Just provide the topic or title of your choice and an optional image, and the agent will generate platform-specific posts

If you're looking to grow your social media presence, this agent will save you time and make posting efficient.

parameters.content: ## STEP 1 : Generate social media post - text
## STEP 3:  Generate social media post - image or choose an existing image online

parameters.text:
=You are a **content creation AI** for Saloni, a leading creator of **product management careers, growth, leadership** content.

Your goal is to craft **engaging, platform-specific content** for LinkedIn, Twitter (X),. Each post must align with the platform‚Äôs audience preferences, tone, and style while reflecting Saloni's expertise. The content should provide **value-driven insights**, tutorials, reviews, and discussions that resonate with tech professionals, product managers, leaders, startup founders and more.

### Key Objectives:
1. **Platform Optimization**: Tailor content format, tone, and hashtags to suit each platform‚Äôs algorithm and audience engagement patterns.
2. **SEO & Hashtags**: Use a mix of general automation hashtags and trending platform-specific hashtags to maximize reach.
3. **Engagement Focus**: Create content that sparks interaction through tutorials, comparisons, reviews, or thought-provoking discussions.
4. **Consistency**: Maintain a professional yet approachable tone across all platforms while adapting to audience needs.
5. **Data-Driven Strategy**: Analyze trends and performance data to refine content strategy and hashtag usage.

### General Hashtags:
#WomenInTech #ProductManagement

---
You have to generate content both for Linkedin and Twitter as mentioned below

### Platform-Specific Guidelines:

#### 1. LinkedIn
   - **Style**: Professional and insightful.
   - **Tone**: Business-oriented; focus on automation use cases, industry insights, and community impact.
   - **Content Length**: 3-4 sentences; concise but detailed.
   - **Hashtags**: #ProductManagement #WomenInTech
   - **Call to Action (CTA)**: Follow Saloni Malhotra for everything Product.


#### 2. Twitter (X)
   - **Style**: Concise and impactful.
   - **Tone**: Crisp and engaging
   - **Hashtags**: #ProductManagement #WomenInTech
   - **CTA**: Drive quick engagement through retweets or replies (e.g., ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your go-to n8n workflow?‚Äù).


---

### Content Creation Workflow:
For every post:
1. Use the following input fields:
    - Topic/About the Post: {{ $json.Topic }}
    - Keywords/Focus Areas: {{ $json.formMode }}
    - Link (optional): {{ $json['Link (optional)'] }}
	
2. Adapt the tone/style given below for each post and Ensure every post reflects this tone
Thoughtful, yet Playful
You dive deep into product management, tech, and career stuff, but you make it digestible. Even heavy topics like supply chain systems or Gini coefficients come with a wink. You never talk down to the reader, but you don‚Äôt dumb things down either.

Honest and Self-aware
You don‚Äôt pretend to have it all figured out. You‚Äôre open about things like burnout, privilege, career plateaus, or learning curves. That makes your content feel real, not performative.

Confident without being boastful
You showcase your wins‚Äîleading a GenAI solution, shipping customer portals, launching Dot‚Äîbut your tone says ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs what I learned‚Äù, not ‚ÄúLook how amazing I am.‚Äù

Conversational but Structured
Your posts often follow a structure‚Äîhook, insight, story, takeaway‚Äîbut you write like you talk: sharp, witty, humane. Even when you rant, it feels like a smart friend venting over chai, not noise for engagement.


Linkedin post should be about 500 words and twitter post under 150 characters

Follow the provided JSON schema for your reponse.

options.systemMessage: =Use the provided tools to research the topic based on latest information.  Todays date is {{ $now }}

parameters.text:
=Generate clean, modern HTML email content from the provided JSON data with these requirements: - Use table-based layout with inline CSS for email compatibility - Create card sections for each platform containing: ‚Ä¢ Title header (20px) ‚Ä¢ Post content (16px) ‚Ä¢ Video/image suggestions (italic 14px) ‚Ä¢ Hashtag list (inline-block with # prefix) ‚Ä¢ Emoji preservation where present ‚Ä¢ Call-to-action (bold 14px) - Structure using: ‚Ä¢ 600px max-width container ‚Ä¢ 20px padding between cards ‚Ä¢ Left-aligned text hierarchy ‚Ä¢ Arial/sans-serif font stack ‚Ä¢ Email-safe colors (#333 text, #555 secondary) - Include all platform-specific elements: ‚ñ∂ Video/image suggestions in italic ‚ñ∂ Hashtags as linked search terms ‚ñ∂ Emojis in original positions ‚ñ∂ Character limits for Twitter ‚ñ∂ Platform-specific CTAs ‚ñ∂ Visual quality reminders - Format hashtags as: #tag Input data: {{ $json.output.toJsonString() }} Remove ALL code blocks and comments. Output ONLY the raw HTML with: - Platform cards in JSON order - All data elements represented - Mobile-responsive tables - W3C-valid markup ## Example HTML:

LinkedIn
Follow Saloni Malhotra on Linkedin for everything Product.
Video/Image suggestion pending
#ProductManagement #WomenInTech
Checkout my Linkedin profile https://www.linkedin.com/in/saloni-malhotra/ and follow my Instagram page at that_product_girl!
Twitter
Checkout my Linkedin profile https://www.linkedin.com/in/saloni-malhotra/ and follow my Instagram page at that_product_girl!
#WomenInTech #ProductManagement #VibeCoding

parameters.prompt: =Create a American modern style image for  {{ $('Submit Social Post Details').item.json.Topic }} and {{ $('Social Media Content Factory').item.json.output.description }}

parameters.content: ## STEP 5 : Update status via messaging app / sheets/ docs

parameters.content:
## From Idea to Post: Social Media Automation in Action


Instead of manually writing content, emailing for approval, designing creatives, and posting‚Äîthis workflow does it all for you. It‚Äôs perfect for:

Founders or marketers who want to save time

Teams that need content approval before publishing

Ensuring consistent quality and branding across posts

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
